item.title: Report E-2024010421
item.description:
Report E-2024010421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-25T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 16, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of gun wash (UN1993) were punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of products to the trailer interior and adjacent boxes of masking paper. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the gun wash fluid-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, the damaged containers were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the impacted masking paper was placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.
